content: clyde baby hat yarn the fibre company tundra one skeins shown in or 68 yds of any bulky yarn needles us #10 5 dpns gauge 12 sts and 16 row = 4 10cm in rib pattern blocked crown cast on 8 sts divide evenly among 4 dpns join placing marker to show beg of round and begin working in the round round 1 *k1 k1f&b repeat from * to end 12 sts round 2 *k2 p1 m1 p-wise repeat from * to end 16 sts round 3 *k2 p2 m1 k-wise repeat from * to end 20 sts round 4 *k2 p2 k1 m1 k-wise repeat from * to end 24 sts begin increasing every other row round 5 *k2 p2 k2 repeat from * to end round 6 *k2 p2 k2 m1 p-wise repeat from * to end 28 sts round 7 *k2 p2 k2 p1 repeat from * to end round 8 *k2 p2 k2 m1 p-wise repeat from * to end 32 sts round 9 *k2 p2 repeat from * to end round 10 * k2 p2 2x m1 k-wise repeat from * to end 36 sts round 11 * k2 p2 2x k1 repeat from * to end round 12 * k2 p2 2x k1 m1 k-wise repeat from * to end 40 sts round 13 * k2 p2 2x k2 repeat from * to end round 14 * k2 p2 2x k2 m1 p-wise repeat from * to end 44 sts round 15 * k2 p2 2x k2 p1 repeat from * to end round 16 * k2 p2 2x k2 p1 m1 p-wise repeat from * to end 48 sts hat *k2 p2 repeat from * to end repeat prev round until hat measures 5 after crown increases cast off very loosely in pattern to keep rib elastic weave in ends when weaving in the cast on end be sure to close up the hole at the top of the hat as you do so notes on blocking in rib patterns if you wash your hat which i recommend you do you ll want to treat it gently soak the hat in cool water and wool wash and then squeeze out as much water as possible in a clean dry towel lay the hat flat on a dry towel do not pull the ribbing out horizontally rather try to keep the ribbing closed try to keep the knit ribs as close to touching each other as possible allow to air dry
